column4: when I try to install a program from a .sh file, it says it needs libstdc++-libc6.2-2.so.3. That file is located at /usr/lib, how do I make the program use that file?
very often when compiling you'll need to install the -dev package,    check in synaptic for libstdc-dev or something like that
I thought that too and have already installed the -dev file
